Description: Black-topped red ware bowl with an inverted plain rim and a rounded base; orangey-brown fabric, black and burnished on the exterior above the carination and the interior surface, deeply incised crisscross lines on the exterior surface below the carination extending across the base. Handmade. The body surface has been pierced six times from the exterior to produce a series of conical mending holes; with four holes along part of the rim and two holes beneath those in the body. Complete but reconstructed with small chips on the rim.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Northern Dongola Reach, Site P37 Grave (F3) Context 20c
Type series: NDRS type B20.15 (published form type series number)
NDRS type D40.10 (published decoration type series number)
Bibliographic references: Welsby Sjöström 2001a / The Pottery from the Survey (p.305, fig. 5.36)
Welsby Sjöström 2001b / Pottery from the Kerma Moyen graves at Site P37 (page 350, fig. 6.2)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sudan Archaeological Research Society
Division of Finds: National Corporation for Antiquities and Museums (NCAM)
Acquisition notes: Division of finds from the National Corporation for Antiquities and Museums, Khartoum to SARS, the license holder.
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: 1346x (excavation type series number)
